args: Is this article primarily about a new action or announcement by the Trump administration/White House/Executive? Respond simply with "yes" or "no" . Supreme Court delays decision on Trump’s firing of watchdog agency leader A divided Supreme Court on Friday put off ruling on the Trump administration’s request to allow the president to remove the leader of an independent government watchdog agency until at least after a lower-court hearing next week. It is the first case to reach the justices involving President Donald Trump’s expansive efforts to reshape the federal bureaucracy. Read the full story
